question.title: What is the primary characteristic of a chalazion?

option_a.title: A chalazion is a type of eyelid condition that typically affects the tarsal surface.

option_b.title: A chalazion is usually caused by a blockage of the meibomian gland.

option_c.title: A chalazion is a type of eyelid condition that typically affects the cutaneous surface.

option_d.title: A chalazion is a type of eyelid condition that typically affects the tarsal surface and is often associated with meibomian gland dysfunction.

correct_option.title: A chalazion is a type of eyelid condition that typically affects the tarsal surface.
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
